history.content:
On the CS side, undergrads can sign up for grad classes with permission of the instructor.  Generally speaking, but not always, instructors will wait until after the first day of class to see if there is room after graduate students have been accommodated.  If you put yourself on the waitlist and talk to the instructor after the first lecture, they can assess if you're prepared to take the class. 

If they want you in the class, they just have to communicate that to me in person or by e-mail. It often helps if the student (after talking to the professor) sends me an e-mail and cc's the faculty member asking them to confirm they want me to move you from the waitlist into the class.

hello, what is the procedure for registering for grad classes as an undegrad?

thanks!
history.subject: getting into grad classes
